triples.name: Belief
triples.relevance: Belief is a core epistemological concept representing a tripartite attitude examined throughout the paper.

triples.name: Credence (statistics)
triples.relevance: Credence is the fine-grained epistemic attitude of subjective probability that the paper analyzes and relates to belief.

triples.name: Subjective probability
triples.relevance: Subjective probability is the mathematical foundation of credence as a measure of rational degree of belief.

triples.name: Epistemology
triples.relevance: Epistemology is the philosophical discipline within which the belief-credence relationship is analyzed.

triples.name: Proposition
triples.relevance: Propositions are the objects toward which beliefs and credences are directed in epistemological analysis.
